Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father Francis Maurice Panveci, Church of Immaculate Conception, 754 Gun Hill Road, Bronx, NY  10467.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER SEARS.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Francis Maurice Panveci, Church of Immaculate Conception, 754 Gun Hill Road, The Bronx,  N.Y.  10467.

Council Member Sears moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Lanza:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20020051 PPR shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City-owned Properties CD#51, SI (C020051PPR)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk cafe located at 647 Ninth Avenue, shall be subject to review by the Council.  (Application no. 20025326 TCM)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 647 9th Ave, Manhattan (20025326TCM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on June 26, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health to serve for a term expiring on May 31, 2004.


Res. No. 428

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY BOARD OF HEALTH 

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health for a term expiring on May 31, 2004.
Items.MatterName: M 222 - Sixto R. Caro, M.D., Board of Health

Res. No. 429

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF DAVID VLAHOV, Ph.D. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY BOARD OF HEALTH

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of DAVID VLAHOV, Ph.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health for a term expiring on May 31, 2004.
Items.MatterName: M 223 - David Vlahov, Ph.D., Board of Health

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on June 26, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health to serve for a term expiring on May 31, 2004.


Res. No. 428

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of SIXTO RAMON CARO, M.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health for a term expiring on May 31, 2004.

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF BRUCE CHARNEY VLADECK, Ph.D. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY BOARD OF HEALTH

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of BRUCE CHARNEY VLADECK, Ph.D. as a member of the New York City Board of Health for a term expiring on May 31, 2008.
Items.MatterName: M 228 - Bruce C. Vladeck, Ph.D., Board of Health

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the duties and obligations of property owners with respect to maintenance, repair or construction of sidewalks as part of government capital reconstruction projects.
Items.MatterName: Duties and obligations of property owners with respect to maintenance, repair or construction of sidewalks

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to updating the standards for gas-fueled unvented room heaters from the 1983 version of ANSI-Z21.11.2 to the 2000 version and authorizing the use of such heaters.
Items.MatterName: Updating the standards for gas fueled unvented room heaters.

Items.Title: Resolution requiring that any resolution passed by the Council to authorize a franchise for privately-operated bus service within the city of New York provide for protection of the jobs, benefits and collective bargaining rights of employees of the current franchise holders.
Items.MatterName: Authorize a franchise for privately-operated bus service within NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring Serena Williams for her Wimbledon win and her role in advancing women's sports.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring Serena Williams for her Wimbledon win .

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the medical community to perform more research involving Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT) and to be more aggressive in finding alternative therapies to alleviate the symptoms of menopause, and urging all women to demand that such actions begin immediately.
Items.MatterName: Perform more research involving Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the possession, sale and display of etching acid.
Items.MatterName: Possession, sale and display of etching acid.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Firefighter William Henry Avenue, Borough of Queens.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Firefighter William Henry Avenue, Queens

Items.Title: Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life of Gen. Benjamin O. Davis Jr., who passed away on July 4, 2002.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Mourning the death and celebrating the life of Gen. Benjamin O. Davis Jr.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to explore the possibility of providing high-rise buildings with state-of-the-art safety and escape devices, such as low-altitude parachutes, tubular net life-chutes, and vertical takeoff and landing (VTOL) aerial rescue platforms.
Items.MatterName: Providing high-rise buildings with state-of-the-art safety and escape devices.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Administration's plans to extend the Job Opportunity Program and calling upon the Administration to expand the program by providing program participants 12 month positions across a range of City job titles, intensive case management services and meaningful educational and training opportunities.
Items.MatterName: Extend the Job Opportunity Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Edmond J. Safra Place, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Edmund J. Safra Place, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of investigation to provide training to city officers and employees, as well as certain public officials, regarding the City’s whistleblower law.
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOI to provide training to city officers and employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and President George W. Bush to sign H.R. 1076, known as "America's Better Classroom Act of 2001."
Items.MatterName: America's Better Classroom Act of 2001.

Items.Title: Resolution observing and declaring July as the American with Disabilities Act Month in the City of New York, and recognizing the contributions of civil rights activist, Justin Dart, Jr., to the enactment of this historic legislation and to the empowerment of the community of people with disabilities in this City, State and Nation.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Declaring July as "American with Disabiltiies Act Month"

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Police Department to clearly display the appropriate police precinct telephone number on motorized and non-motorized police vehicles.
Items.MatterName: NYPD to clearly display the appropriate police precinct telephone number on all vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting U.S. Senator Charles Schumer's call for increased milk distribution in schools.
Items.MatterName: Increased milk distribution in schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the appropriate Committee of the Council to hold a hearing to assess the condition of fire alarm safety systems in public schools throughout New York City and to evaluate the safety implications of the Board of Education's recent decision to cancel life safety system contracts for 50 public schools.
Items.MatterName: Assess the condition of fire alarm safety systems in public schools throughout NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to file an amicus brief on behalf of the plaintiff in Campaign for Fiscal Equity v. State of New York in the appeal of the Supreme Court Appellate Division's decision.
Items.MatterName: Campaign for Fiscal Equity v. State of New York in the appeal of the Supreme Court Appellate Division's decision.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold oversight hearings to examine New York City's procedures for collecting fines.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in nineteen business improvement districts.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in nineteen BIDs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the extension of the Metrotech Area business improvement district.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Metrotech Area BID.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all taxicabs to have child booster seats available for passenger use.

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: Int 238,  Res 184,  Res 431, LU 208 & Res 421.  See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned the meeting In Memory of Margarie Messinger, mother of former Council Member and Manhattan Borough President Ruth Messinger; the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, August 15, 2002.
